page.title: 06Transport - Rail and Bus
page.content: The area is crossed by a railway line linking Sheerness with the main North Kent line at Sittingbourne. Whilst primarily for freight to and from Sheerness Steelworks and Docks, it also provides a half hourly passenger service with a halt at Kemsley. There is an hourly bus service linking Kemsley with Sittingbourne but Iwade is poorly served with only four buses a day. The National Bus Co run a regular daily commuter service to London, called 'Invictaway', which passes through Iwade , Kemsley and Milton. Private coach owners run coaches to Maidstone market every Tuesday. Because of the infrequent services in many areas and as many local inhabitants do not have cars they beging to feel isolated.
